title: Displacer beast
data:
The **displacer beast**, f, is a [feline](/wiki/Feline "Feline") monster that first appears in [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), and also appear in [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM") and [xNetHack](/wiki/XNetHack "XNetHack"). They have natural [displacement](/wiki/Displacement "Displacement").

Across variants, each time you attempt to attack a displacer beast in melee, you have around a 50% chance of merely displacing it like a [pet](/wiki/Pet "Pet"). Using [F](/wiki/F "F") to force an attack will not move you or the displacer beast, and results in attacking "thin air" if you would have displaced it. In dNetHack they cannot actually displace you, you will just miss.

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([NetHack 3.7.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.7.0 "NetHack 3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

Displacer beasts have been introduced to vanilla in the upcoming NetHack 3.7, with the same traits as detailed in the xNetHack tab below.

## Description

[x][ ][ ][ ]

- SLASH'EM
- dNetHack
- SlashTHEM
- xNetHack

| A displacer beast:* has no hands.
* is an [animal](/wiki/Animal "Animal").
* is [carnivorous](/wiki/Carnivore "Carnivore").
* is normally generated [hostile](/wiki/Hostile "Hostile").
* can be seen through [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision").
* may [turn against you](/wiki/Treachery "Treachery") when tame. |                                                                                                               |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                               |
| **[Reference](/wiki/Source_code "Source code")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               | [SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2/monst.c#line662](/wiki/SLASH%27EM_0.0.7E7F2/monst.c#line662 "SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2/monst.c") |

Displacer beasts can pose a real problem in combat - in addition to their intrinsic displacement rendering around half your melee attacks harmless, they also have a very low AC and high HP, and can do quite a bit of damage. Luckily, they are not fast, and a player with [speed](/wiki/Speed "Speed") should be able to outrun them. This is particularly advisable if there are other hostile monsters around, since missed attacks leave you open to retaliation from them and the displacer beast itself.

Amusingly, you can displace a displacer beast into water or lava, killing it instantly.

In dNetHack, displacer beasts have [flight](/wiki/Flight "Flight"), and thus cannot be killed by displacement into water or lava. They additionally can turn traitor when tame. When you miss a displacer beast (or other displacing monster) due to its displacement, you do not swap places with it.

| A displacer beast:* has no hands.
* is an [animal](/wiki/Animal "Animal").
* is [carnivorous](/wiki/Carnivore "Carnivore").
* is normally generated [hostile](/wiki/Hostile "Hostile").
* is [nasty](/wiki/M2_NASTY "M2 NASTY").
* can be seen through [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision"). |                                                                                                                      |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |                                                                                                                      |
| **[Reference](/wiki/Source_code "Source code")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       | [xNetHack include/monsters.h, line 389](https://github.com/copperwater/xNetHack/blob/master/include/monsters.h#L389) |

In xNetHack, displacer beasts are eligible to be summoned with the [summon nasties](/wiki/Summon_nasties "Summon nasties") [monster spell](/wiki/Monster_spell "Monster spell"). Eating displacer beast meat confers intrinsic [displacement](/wiki/Displacement "Displacement") for 6d6 turns.

## Origin

The displacer beast is a *[Dungeons & Dragons](/wiki/Dungeons_%26_Dragons "Dungeons & Dragons")*, monster that projects a displaced image a few feet from where it actually stands. It is the source mythology for the displacement provided by the [cloak of displacement](/wiki/Cloak_of_displacement "Cloak of displacement").

[![This article may require revision for the next version of SLASH'EM. Click here for more information.](/images/3/38/Se7e7-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article may require revision for the next version of SLASH'EM. Click here for more information.")

[![This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.](/images/5/5d/Nh343var-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.")
html:
Displacer beast

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search

The displacer beast, f, is a feline monster that first appears in SLASH'EM, and also appear in dNetHack, SlashTHEM and xNetHack. They have natural displacement.

Across variants, each time you attempt to attack a displacer beast in melee, you have around a 50% chance of merely displacing it like a pet. Using F to force an attack will not move you or the displacer beast, and results in attacking "thin air" if you would have displaced it. In dNetHack they cannot actually displace you, you will just miss.

The following information pertains to an upcoming version (NetHack 3.7.0). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.

Displacer beasts have been introduced to vanilla in the upcoming NetHack 3.7, with the same traits as detailed in the xNetHack tab below.

Description

f displacer beast
Difficulty 14
Attacks Claw 4d4, Claw 4d4, Bite 2d10
f displacer beast
Difficulty 14
Attacks

Claw 4d4, Claw 4d4, Bite 2d10

Base level 12
Base experience 301
Speed 12
Base AC -10
Base MR 0
Alignment -3 (chaotic)
Frequency (by normal means) 1 (Very rare)
Genocidable Yes
Weight 750
Nutritional value 400
Size Large
Resistances None
Resistances conveyed None

A displacer beast:

  • has no hands.
  • is an animal.
  • is carnivorous.
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • can be seen through infravision.
  • may turn against you when tame.
Reference SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2/monst.c#line662

Displacer beasts can pose a real problem in combat - in addition to their intrinsic displacement rendering around half your melee attacks harmless, they also have a very low AC and high HP, and can do quite a bit of damage. Luckily, they are not fast, and a player with speed should be able to outrun them. This is particularly advisable if there are other hostile monsters around, since missed attacks leave you open to retaliation from them and the displacer beast itself.

Amusingly, you can displace a displacer beast into water or lava, killing it instantly.

The displacer beast is a Dungeons & Dragons, monster that projects a displaced image a few feet from where it actually stands. It is the source mythology for the displacement provided by the cloak of displacement.

rawPage:
The '''displacer beast''', {{monsym|displacer beast}}, is a [[feline]] monster that first appears in [[SLASH'EM]], and also appear in [[dNetHack]], [[SlashTHEM]] and [[xNetHack]]. They have natural [[displacement]].

Across variants, each time you attempt to attack a displacer beast in melee, you have around a 50% chance of merely displacing it like a [[pet]]. Using {{kbd|F}} to force an attack will not move you or the displacer beast, and results in attacking "thin air" if you would have displaced it. In dNetHack they cannot actually displace you, you will just miss.

{{upcoming|NetHack 3.7.0|Displacer beasts have been introduced to vanilla in the upcoming NetHack 3.7, with the same traits as detailed in the xNetHack tab below.}}

==Description==
<simpletabs>
 SLASH'EM|{{monster
 |name=displacer beast
 |difficulty=14
 |level=12
 |speed=12
 |AC=-10
 |MR=0

 |attacks=Claw 4d4, Claw 4d4, Bite 2d10
 |weight=750
 |nutr=400
 |size=Large
 |genocidable=Yes
 |frequency=1
 |resistances=None
 |resistances conveyed=None
 |attributes={{attributes|A displacer beast|animal=1|nohands=1|carnivore=1|hostile=1|infravisible=1|traitor=1}}
 |reference = [[SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2/monst.c#line662]]
}}
Displacer beasts can pose a real problem in combat - in addition to their intrinsic displacement rendering around half your melee attacks harmless, they also have a very low AC and high HP, and can do quite a bit of damage. Luckily, they are not fast, and a player with [[speed]] should be able to outrun them. This is particularly advisable if there are other hostile monsters around, since missed attacks leave you open to retaliation from them and the displacer beast itself.

Amusingly, you can displace a displacer beast into water or lava, killing it instantly.

dNetHack|{{monster
 |name=displacer beast

 |attributes={{attributes|A displacer beast|nohands=1|animal=1|carnivore=1|hostile=1|strong=1|infravisible=1|traitor=1}}
 |reference=[https://github.com/Chris-plus-alphanumericgibberish/dNAO/blob/compat-3.21.1/src/monst.c#L705 dNetHack src/monst.c, line 705]
}}
In dNetHack, displacer beasts have [[flight]], and thus cannot be killed by displacement into water or lava. They additionally can turn traitor when tame. When you miss a displacer beast (or other displacing monster) due to its displacement, you do not swap places with it.

In xNetHack, displacer beasts are eligible to be summoned with the [[summon nasties]] [[monster spell]]. Eating displacer beast meat confers intrinsic [[displacement]] for 6d6 turns.

<!--==Variants== <- in preparation for 3.7.0's eventual release-->

==Origin==
The displacer beast is a ''[[Dungeons & Dragons]]'', monster that projects a displaced image a few feet from where it actually stands. It is the source mythology for the displacement provided by the [[cloak of displacement]].
